trends.name: 4D Imaging Radar Transition
trends.description: Traditional radar systems only measure distance, speed, and angle. New 4D imaging radar adds height detection and creates detailed 3D maps of surroundings, similar to how lidar works but using radio waves instead of laser light. This enables better object classification and works in all weather conditions.
trends.silicon_implication: Requires high-performance signal processing chips with 10-100x more computational power than current radar processors.

evidence.key_quote: 4D imaging radar will be standard in premium vehicles by 2025, requiring new generations of radar signal processors with AI acceleration capabilities
evidence.patent_filings: Over 200 patents filed in 2023 by major suppliers

trends.name: Centralized ADAS Computing Architecture
trends.description: Instead of having separate computer boxes for each camera and sensor, automakers are moving toward one powerful central computer that processes all sensor data. Think of it like replacing multiple small computers with one supercomputer that handles everything.
trends.silicon_implication: Drives demand for high-performance automotive System-on-Chips (SoCs) with 500+ TOPS AI processing power.

evidence.key_quote: Centralized compute architectures will account for 60% of new ADAS designs by 2027, up from 15% today
evidence.patent_filings: Tesla, NVIDIA, and Qualcomm lead with 150+ related patents each

trends.name: 8K Camera Resolution Standard
trends.description: ADAS cameras are jumping from current 2-4 megapixel resolution to 8K (33 megapixels) to better detect small objects like traffic signs, pedestrians, and road markings at longer distances. This is like upgrading from standard definition TV to ultra-high definition.
trends.silicon_implication: Requires image sensor processors capable of handling 4-8x more pixel data in real-time with advanced compression.

evidence.key_quote: 8K resolution enables 40% improvement in object detection accuracy at distances beyond 150 meters compared to 4K systems
evidence.patent_filings: Sony and OmniVision dominate with 80+ sensor patents each

trends.name: Edge AI Processing Integration
trends.description: Instead of sending all sensor data to a central brain for analysis, smart sensors now include their own AI chips to make basic decisions instantly. Like having mini-computers in each camera that can immediately recognize a stop sign without waiting for instructions.
trends.silicon_implication: Creates new market for low-power AI accelerator chips optimized for specific sensor types.

evidence.key_quote: Edge AI ADAS patents increased 180% in 2023, with focus on 'sensor-embedded neural processing units'
evidence.patent_filings: Mobileye leads with 120+ edge AI patents, followed by Qualcomm with 95+

trends.name: ASIL-D Safety Compliance Expansion
trends.description: ASIL-D is the highest automotive safety standard, like having multiple backup systems for critical functions. More ADAS features now require this level of safety, meaning if the main system fails, backup systems must take over within milliseconds to prevent accidents.
trends.silicon_implication: Necessitates redundant processing architectures and specialized safety monitoring circuits in semiconductor designs.

evidence.key_quote: By 2026, 80% of Level 2+ ADAS functions will require ASIL-D certification, up from 30% today

trends.name: Ultra-Low Power Sensor Networking
trends.description: Cars are adding more sensors (sometimes 20+ cameras and radars), but the electrical system can't handle the power draw. New designs focus on sensors that sip power like a smartphone in sleep mode while staying alert for important events.
trends.silicon_implication: Drives innovation in power management ICs and ultra-low-power sensor interface chips.

evidence.key_quote: Average vehicle sensor power consumption must drop 60% by 2028 to meet electrification targets while maintaining always-on capability
evidence.patent_filings: Power management patents in automotive up 35% in 2023

trends.name: Sensor Fusion at Silicon Level
trends.description: Instead of processing camera, radar, and other sensor data separately then combining results, new chips merge different sensor inputs at the hardware level. Like having a translator that understands multiple languages simultaneously rather than translating each separately.
trends.silicon_implication: Requires specialized multi-modal processing units that can handle different data types on single chips.

evidence.key_quote: Hardware-level sensor fusion reduces processing latency by 75% compared to software fusion approaches
evidence.patent_filings: Qualcomm and NVIDIA lead with 60+ fusion processor patents each

acronyms.ADAS: Advanced Driver Assistance Systems - features like automatic emergency braking and lane keeping
acronyms.SoC: System-on-Chip - a complete computer system built into a single semiconductor chip
acronyms.TOPS: Tera Operations Per Second - measure of AI processing speed (1 TOPS = 1 trillion calculations per second)
acronyms.ASIL-D: Automotive Safety Integrity Level D - highest safety standard requiring multiple backup systems
acronyms.AI: Artificial Intelligence - computer systems that can learn and make decisions like humans
acronyms.4D: Four-dimensional - traditional 3D space (length, width, height) plus time/motion
